description: These Todos are only loaded over the season of Summer

items.title: Disc Golf

description.text: Grab some discs from one of our sports stores and head to Angel Mounds, Woodmere, Mesker Park, or Eagle Valley!

items.title: Road Trip to Garden of the Gods

description.text: Time for a road trip! Take in some scenic Southern Illinois views in Herod, Illinois

items.title: Go For a Swim at Burdette Park

description.text: Burdette Park Aquatic Center offers something for everyone in the family.  One of the largest aquatic centers in the Midwest, it features a large Olympic pool with two diving boards.  There is a family pool with two breathtaking slides, and a children’s pool with a floating alligator and snake closely guarded by a skilled team of guards and EMT’s.  There is even an exciting interactive spray park for smaller children and an awesome speed slide to delight the more adventurous.
Burdette Park

items.title: Take a Stroll through Downtown Evansville

description.text: We strive to be the most vibrant urban district in the region, filled with unparalleled opportunities in which to live, work, learn, dine, invest and play among great public spaces, happy people and thriving businesses.
You can expect enticing outdoor dining with spectacular views of Main Street
Downtown Evansville

items.title: Observe the Wildlife at Eagle Slough

description.text: Eagle Slough is 127 acres of wetlands north of Ellis Park. One hundred species of birds and wildlife have been identified among the forests and lakes. Wildlife viewing platforms and trails with parking are available. A project of the Sycamore Land Trust.
Eagle Slough

items.title: Go For a Walk Through Garvin Park

description.text: Garvin Park is one of Evansville's oldest parks. Purchased in 1915, the 80 acres provides a large lake, swimming pool, playground, tennis and basketball courts. It is located next to historic Bosse Field. Garvin Park is listed on the National Register of Historical Places and is a favorite for public gatherings. During the month of December, the local Easter Seals features the Ritzy Fantasy of Lights for the Christmas season.
Garvin Park

items.title: Observe the Wildlife at Howell Wetlands

description.text: This is one of the largest urban wetlands in Indiana. This rare ecosystem is an appealing year-round location for education and outdoor enjoyment. The 35-acre property includes a variety of habitats. Beavers have made Howell Wetlands their home along with eagles,cranes, migrating birds, coyotes, bobcats, raccoons, and possums.
Howell Wetlands

items.title: Swing, Slide and Play at Mickey's Kingdom

description.text: Mickey's Kingdom was built from the ground up by a dedicated community full of generous volunteers. This 21,000 sq.ft. playground was built for children of ALL abilities ensuring play time for everyone! The park structures were made from recycled milk jugs and have a rubber surface, You will also find the world's tallest solar CommuniTree there.

items.title: Have a Night Out at NOCO Park

description.text: NOCO PARK is an outdoor food and bar experience. Located in downtown Evansville, NOCO Park is an empty lot turned into a magical place. We will feature a rotating lineup of food trucks, games, music and art installations. Beautiful indoor and outdoor spaces are available for events and celebrations.
NOCO Park

items.title: Walk, Run, or Bike the Pigeon Creek Greenway Passage

description.text: When completed, the Pigeon Creek Greenway Passage will encompass 42 miles of pedestrian and bicycle trails that encircle the city. Linking communities and providing a natural refuge from busy streets, the Greenway will be a linear park and trail system that ultimately extends into adjacent counties linking with the American Discovery Trail, an interstate system of trails crossing the U.S.
Pigeon Creek Greenway Passage

items.title: Go Fishing at River City Catfishing

description.text: The thrill of reeling in a big one is a feeling unlike any other. Catch a memory that will last a lifetime with River City Catfishing!
River City Catfishing

items.title: Walk or Bike the Riverfront

description.text: A brick paved walkway above and tiered seating below provide the perfect setting to view the spectacular Ohio River. A boat ramp with parking is available along the lower plaza. See the epic Fireworks on the Ohio show every 4th of July. Framed by the inspiring Four Freedoms Monument and Bally's Casino, the Riverfront invites walkers, runners and cyclists to enjoy the lovely Front Door to our city.

items.title: Paddle Pigeon Creek from the Canoe Launch

description.text: Pigeon Creek meanders for miles through Evansville's northeast side to its juncture with the Ohio River near downtown.  Located on Green River Road one quarter of a mile north from Lynch Road, the Rotary Kayak/Canoe Launch allows access to Pigeon Creek. It offers paddlers the opportunity to enjoy Evansville's 6-mile “blue trail.”

items.title: Grab a Board at Sunset Skatepark

description.text: The Sunset Skatepark will be an accessible, ALL-WHEEL park for everything from wheelchairs, skateboards, scooters, bikes, rollerskates, and rollerblades. With 27,000 sqft of skate-scape, this is Indiana's largest skate park.
Sunset Skatepark

items.title: Go for a Bike Ride with the Upgrade Bike Share

description.text: Easily rent a bike and pickup and dropoff at multiple locations around the city
Upgrade Bike Share

items.title: Explore the USI Trails

description.text: USI boasts many miles of multi-use trails on its scenic 1,400-acre campus open to the University community and to the public. The most recent trail is the three-mile paved USI-Burdette Trail.
USI Trails

items.title: Vist the Vanderburgh 4-H Center

description.text: 200 acres of rolling hllls and multi-use buildings including Audiotorium, Activities Center, Banquet Hall, Expo Hall, Conference Room, Grandstand arena and more.
Vanderburgh 4-H Center

items.title: Practice your Swing at Walther's Golf Range

description.text: Artificial and natural grass practice tees, a pitching range with sand trap, heated, covered tees in winter and air conditioned tees for summer. Professional lessons also provided by appointment.
Walther's Golf Range

items.title: Explore Wesselman Park

description.text: Adjacent to the Nature Preserve, Wesselman Park features a Par 3 golf course, tennis courts, sand volleyball courts, softball fields, a playground and more!
Wesselman Park

items.title: Explore the Wildlife of Wesselman Woods

description.text: Wesselman Woods is the largest urban old-growth forest in the United States. We protect the cultural and ecological integrity of this 200-acre forest while providing environmental education, anumal encounters and outdoor recreation experiences to enrich the lives of everyone. The nature playscape offers five acres of unstructured play and exploration including a bird sanctuary. Eco-Access Initiative invites you to enjoy over 4 miles of trails, the playscape and the bird sanctuary at no charge on Family Free Days, the last Saturday of each month in 2023.
Wesselman Woods
